body: They might automatically use a different font which supports bold weight. Alacritty can do that too by specifying a different bold font.

Well, Meslo Nerd Font is the only Meslo font installed in my system, and I would have noticed if `st`, my previous emulator, had chosen a different typeface for the italic and bold weights... but I can check that, of course

issue.title: Font weight
issue.body:
I'm trying to use a font (Monaco) that does not have an italic / bold variant. Until now I relied upon FreeType having the ability to create these missing styles, and it works like a charm in e.g urxvt `URxvt.font: xft:Monaco:weight=200:size=10`, st `static char *font = "Monaco:weight=200:size=10";` and other software like vscode. I tried adding the `weight` property to the alacritty config:
```yaml
 # Bold font face
  bold:
    family: Monaco
    weight: 200
```
However it doesn't seem to work, and I didn't find detailed documentation on this other than the comments in the default conf. [This](https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/font_configuration#Create_bold_and_italic_styles_for_incomplete_fonts) might be a solution, but the cache location `/usr/share/fonts/fonts.cache-1` looks to be outdated, I need to delve into that.

I'm new to the Linux font stack (Arch, X11), please let me know if something I assumed is incorrect or I missed any clearly written documentation. Thanks!

issue.title: Doesn't display italic font
issue.body:
OS: macOS 10.14.2

I'm using a `Fantasque Sans` patched by [nerd fonts](https://github.com/ryanoasis/nerd-fonts), and here is my alacritty config:

```yaml
# Font configuration (changes require restart)
font:
  # Normal (roman) font face
  normal:
    family: FantasqueSansMono Nerd Font
    # The `style` can be specified to pick a specific face.
    style: Regular

  # Bold font face
  bold:
    family: FantasqueSansMono Nerd Font
    # The `style` can be specified to pick a specific face.
    style: Bold

  # Italic font face
  italic:
    family: FantasqueSansMono Nerd Font
    # The `style` can be specified to pick a specific face.
    style: Italic
```

In alacritty I can't see any italic fonts (iTerm2 can display italic fonts correctly), and here are two screenshots of alacritty and iTerm2 opening a same file using vim:

issue.title: Support embolden and hinting for fonts on Linux
issue.body: Hello, would it be possible to support font options such as embolden and hinting for Linux fonts? Setting them system-wide with fontconfig has no effect on Alacritty. It'd be great if it were possible because right now the only workaround I found in order to have macOS-like fonts in Alacritty is setting 'Regular' to 'Bold' which is suboptimal for obvious reasons.

issue.body: Embolden is a FreeType feature which increases the weight of a regular font if no bold variant of that font is found. I'm not sure if this feature is already supported but making changes in the fontconfig (linux) does not do anything. Here is an issue and PR in alacritty that explains this in detail https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/1754 https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/pull/3703
